column4: Hi I've got a question regarding ifconfig if a normal users runs it gets the responce "Warning: cannot open /proc/net/dev (No such file or directory). Limited output." -- But if I run it as sudo it displays fine :/
Is there anyway to allow normal users access to it?
setuid on it
how does one do that?
chmod http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Setuid
I tried a chmod 777 -R /proc/net/dev ikonia it did nothing
no, that's not setting the setuid bit
and you need to do it on the ifconfig binary
proc is a dynamic file system that gets re-created everytime the system boots, so it's pointless modifying that
Ah
I still don't understand how setuid works tbh
have a read of that page.

How I apply that to allowing normal users to view ifconfig
so if you set the setuid on the binary, users can use it as "root"
it executes as the user, but assume certain root privileges
so you just set it on the binary, not for one user, just set it on the binary.
